notes: Second generation W203 (2000-2007). C32 AMG features supercharged V8. Available in sedan, coupe, and hatchback (Sport Coupe) variants. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz C-Class article, January 2025 revision.
Third generation W204 (2007-2014). C63 AMG features naturally aspirated 6.2L V8. Coupe variant introduced in 2011. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz C-Class article, January 2025 revision.

Fourth generation W211 (2002-2009). E55 AMG features supercharged 5.4L V8 producing 469 hp. E63 AMG introduced in 2006 with naturally aspirated V8. Wagon variant available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz E-Class article, January 2025 revision.

Fifth generation W220 (1998-2005). S55 AMG features supercharged 5.4L V8. S600 has 6.0L V12 twin-turbo. AIRMATIC air suspension. Complex electronics require specialized diagnostics. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz S-Class article, January 2025 revision.

Fifth generation W221 (2005-2013). S63 AMG features supercharged V8, S65 AMG has V12 twin-turbo. Advanced AIRMATIC suspension. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz S-Class article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation C209 (2002-2009). CLK55 AMG features supercharged V8. Available in coupe and convertible variants. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz CLK-Class article, January 2025 revision.

First generation C219 (2004-2010). Four-door coupe design pioneered the segment. CLS55 AMG features supercharged V8, CLS63 AMG has naturally aspirated 6.2L V8. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz CLS-Class article, January 2025 revision.
First generation R171 (2004-2011). SLK55 AMG features naturally aspirated 5.4L V8. Retractable hardtop convertible. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz SLK-Class article, January 2025 revision.

Fifth generation R230 (2001-2011). SL55 AMG features supercharged V8, SL65 AMG has V12 twin-turbo producing 604 hp. Retractable hardtop. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz SL-Class article, January 2025 revision.
First generation W163 (1997-2005). Built in Alabama. ML55 AMG features supercharged V8. First Mercedes SUV. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz M-Class article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation W164 (2005-2011). ML320 CDI features 3.0L V6 diesel. ML63 AMG has naturally aspirated 6.2L V8. Diesel variant requires diesel service expertise. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz M-Class article, January 2025 revision.

First generation X164 (2006-2012). GL320 CDI features 3.0L V6 diesel. GL63 AMG produces 503 hp. Seven-passenger seating. Diesel variants require specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz GL-Class article, January 2025 revision.

First generation W463 (1990-2018). Body-on-frame with three locking differentials. G55 AMG features supercharged V8. Requires familiarity with complex 4WD system. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz G-Class article, January 2025 revision.

First generation W251 (2005-2017). Sports tourer design with three-row seating. R320 CDI features 3.0L V6 diesel. R63 AMG has 503 hp V8. Diesel variants require specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercedes-Benz R-Class article, January 2025 revision.
